newsitem.title: USA: N.Y Authority affirms $100 mln sale subject to AMT.
newsitem.headline: N.Y Authority affirms $100 mln sale subject to AMT.

text.p: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey on Tuesday affirmed that $100 million of 20-year bonds that it plans to sell on Wednesday will be subject to the Alternative Minimum Tax (AMT).

The agency, which said it was clarifying confusion caused by a newswire report, explained that the new bonds will replace issues that were subject to this federal tax, which aimed to ensure holders pay at least a minimum rate.
"It is subject to the AMT," said Anne Marie Mulligan, a debt manager at the Port Authority. She added that the competitive sale is set for October 16 at 1100 EDT.
